result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley Amira Glover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ashley Amira Glover in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 7, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Status hearing scheduled on 7/19/16 is not a criminal day for Branch II. Matter rescheduled to 7/07/16 at 2:15 pm.

Defendant Ashley Amira Glover appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advises defendant appeared late to court yesterday and then turned self in yesterday.  Counsel requesting July date, indicating defendant taking DL class in June.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves for warrant, forfeiting any bail. Upon defendant's failure to appear, court orders warrant to issue. Forfeit any bail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Off the record. Defendant Ashley Amira Glover in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests new date for defendant to obtain license.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-07-2016 10:30 am

Held off the record. Defendant Ashley Amira Glover in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests additional time for defendant to obtain license.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

same conditions as previously ordered

Defendant Ashley Amira Glover not in court. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.  Upon defendant's failure to appear, court orders warrant to issue. Forfeit any bail.

Defendant Ashley Amira Glover in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes additional time to speak to the public defender.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant and gives defendant until 10/15/15 to either obtain private counsel or the public defender and inform the court in writing if she wishes to represent herself.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing scheduled for 10/12/15 at 8:30 am

State appears by Attorney Jeff Sisley. Defendant in custody appearing by video from Ozaukee County Jail. Attorney Rachel Alme-Boaz in court. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender. Counsel waives reading. Court advises defendant of penalties. Court finds probable cause. State requests $250 signature bond. Court orders $250 signature bond and to confim address.
